arm_group.description: Heavy resistance training of the lower and upper extremities three times weekly for 52 weeks.
Home-based moderate intensity training of the lower and upper extremities three times weekly for 52 weeks. The subjects are encouraged to do supplemental endurance training.

brief_summary.textblock:
A minimum of 450 healthy individuals (62-70 years old) will be recruited.

      Each individual will be randomized into one of three groups stratified according to gender
      (M/F), BMI (≤28/>28), and 30 sec chair stand (≤11/>11). The three groups are Heavy
      resistance training (n=150), moderate intensity training (n=150), and control (n=150, no
      training).

      Assessments will be performed at baseline, after 12 months of intervention. Furthermore,
      follow up will be performed after 2,3,5, and 10 years.

      The primary outcome is change in quadriceps muscle power after the intervention and during
      follow up.

      The primary hypothesis is that by applying the intention-to-treat analysis, the moderate
      intensity training group will increase quadriceps muscle power just as much as the heavy
      resistance training group. The two training groups will increase muscle power more than the
      control group.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Activity as Intervention Against Age-related Loss of Muscle Mass and Function

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Independently living men and women

          -  Between 62 and 70 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Subjects dependent on help/nursing etc.

          -  Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, cardiac arrhythmias or known decreased
             left ventricular ejection fraction, non-treated hyper/hypothyroidism, dementia,
             active cancer.

          -  Surgical diseases: Bone, muscle, tendon or joint injuries compromising participation
             in exercise regimens.

          -  Implanted magnetic devices incompatible with MRi-scanning.

          -  >1 hour of exercise weekly, except light activities such as stretching/gymnastics and
             bike-riding/walking as transportation.

intervention.description: Supervised heavy resistance training three times weekly for 52 weeks.
Home-based moderate intensity training three times weekly for 52 weeks.The subjects are encouraged to do supplemental endurance training.
Change in habitual physical activity level during the follow-up period (2,3,5, 10 after).

clinical_study.official_title: Physical Activity as Intervention Against Age-related Loss of Muscle Mass and Function

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Danish National Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

primary_outcome.description: Unilateral leg extension power measured in the Leg Extensor Power Rig device (Nottingham). The primary time interval for assessment of the primary outcome measure is from baseline to 12 months intervention. The statistical evaluation of the primary outcome measure is done by applying a two way ANOVA test comparing the three groups before/after the intervention and during follow up (2,3,5,10 years).

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: MRI scanning of thigh muscle composition
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quadriceps cross sectional area

secondary_outcome.description: Unilateral maximal isometric quadriceps strength measured in the Good Strength device.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in maximal isometric quadriceps strength

secondary_outcome.description: Number of stand-ups from a chair in 30 seconds
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in 30 s chair stand performance

secondary_outcome.description: The time used for walking 400 m (20 m course)
Body composition (fat mass, lean mass and bone mass) evaluated by whole-body dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA)-scanning.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in whole body composition and bone mineral density

secondary_outcome.description: Determination of perceived age from facial and whole-body photographs
Measuring 1) blood levels of inflammatory markers (CRP, TNFa, and IL-6) and HbA1c, plasma lipids. 2) Weight, abdominal circumference, blood pressure.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in blood parameters and anthropometry

secondary_outcome.description: Wearing a pedometer device (ActivPal) for 7 continuous days. Questionnaire: PASE (Physical Activity Scale for the Elderly).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Health Related Quality of Life

secondary_outcome.description: MRI scanning of the regional brain structure and function
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in brain structure and function

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention
